User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Digital Folio application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

displayName.description: The display name of the user.

theme.description: The UI theme selected by the user (e.g., 'light', 'dark').

KnowledgeEntry.title: KnowledgeEntry
KnowledgeEntry.description: Represents a knowledge entry, such as a novel, project, or idea, stored in the Digital Folio.

id.description: Unique identifier for the KnowledgeEntry entity.

type.description: Type of the knowledge entry (e.g., 'Novel', 'Large Project', 'Small Project', 'Code Snippet', 'Idea', 'Account Info', 'Exception').

content.description: The text content of the knowledge entry.  Can be rich text or code.

filePaths.description: Array of file paths for attached files or folders.

links.description: Array of URLs associated with the entry.

dateCreated.description: The date and time the knowledge entry was created.

dateModified.description: The date and time the knowledge entry was last modified.

definition.description: Stores user profile information.  The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Authentication UID. This path enforces path-based ownership: only the authenticated user can read/write their own profile.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Authentication UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores knowledge entries for each user. The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Authentication UID. This path enforces path-based ownership: only the authenticated user can read/write their own knowledge entries.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Authentication UID of the user.

params.name: knowledgeEntryId
params.description: The unique ID of the knowledge entry.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to address the 'auth/unauthorized-domain' error and support the application's data storage needs, focusing on security, scalability, and ease of debugging.  The core structure is path-based ownership for user data, and all collections have homogeneous security postures.

The structure enforces Authorization Independence by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. All authorization information is derived from `request.auth.uid` and the document path.  The application only uses authenticated users, and relies on ownership, and segregated collections to enforce security.

Collection segregation is used extensively. User-owned data is stored under `/users/{userId}` to ensure that each user only has access to their own data. There are no global roles or custom claims.

The structure supports secure `list` operations (QAPs) by restricting access based on path-based ownership. A user can only list knowledge entries in their own collection.

Ownership and timestamps are maintained and can be used to enforce invariants, ensuring data integrity.
